intro: Sphedamnocarpus vohitrotsyensis, commonly known as the Madagascar spurge, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with latex-producing characteristics. The plant is notable for its unique floral structure, featuring cyathium inflorescences that are typical of the genus. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its restricted distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
